newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends weaker on Central Bank buying.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends weaker on Central Bank buying.

text.p: The Philippine peso closed weaker at 26.276 to the dollar on Tuesday against 26.273 after the Central Bank bought dollars to stem the peso's steady rise, traders said.
"The peso was rising early in the morning. But the Central Bank stepped in and started buying dollars," a trader said.
The peso hit an intra-day high of 26.269 in the morning, but the Central Bank stepped in to buy at 26.273 and 26.274.

Another trader said a local bank took the cue from Central Bank and started bidding dollars up to cover commercial requirements. It was exacerbated by oil companies which also bought $23 million at 26.272 and 26.273.
"But the market is long on dollars. Many sellers came out when the rate hit 26.276," he said.
Market turnover reached $125.3 million as compared with $79.3 million yesterday.
The parallel market was trading higher than the official rate due to the higher corporate demand.
